About Us


This project is developed, maintained, and managed by the FreeMoCap Foundation a registered non-profit corporation in the State of Massachusetts (IRS 501c3 federal tax-exempt status pending at time of writing in March 2022).

[Need add 'brief history of freemocap' thing - Send them to the GOSH talk and also maybe Ian Failes podcast]

This project represents an effort by Jon Matthis to align his personal/professional scientific interests/activities in the neural control of human movement in natural environments [LINK JONMATTHIS.COM] with a direct public need (inacessiblity of motion capture technology) that derives from a larger scale societal inequity (inaccessibility of high science and technology).

The FreeMoCap project is now and shall remain a long-term effort and a work in progress.

Support Us


✨ The best way to support FreeMoCap is to use it to fulfill your own needs ✨
It is a gift freely given and usage carries no obligation.
Attribution is deeply appreciated and will help secure the support necessary to maintain this project.


If you would like to contibute financially, we provide links to a variey of donation services below. If your preferred method is not listed please let us know via the Contact link.

At time of writing (March 2020), FreeMoCap's tax exampt status is pending. Eligible donations made to the Foundation may be retro-actively considered tax-exempt provided that we gain 501c3 status within 27 months of the date of incorporation (i.e. March 2024 - link : https://www.irs.gov/charities-non-profits/charitable-organizations/contributions-to-organization-with-irs-application-pending )

Per the legal obligations of a 501c3 tax exempt organization, the annual revenue to the FreeMoCap Foundation will be reported via an IRS 990 form and in an annual report to be published in the late-summer/early-fall of each year.
